# Introduction to HTML{#html}

This chapter will teach the basics of HTML.

## What is HTML for?

* HTML5 is the abbreviation of `Hyper Text Markup Language`.
* It defines the structure of a web page.
* It consists of a series of elements defined by specific commands. Each command expresses a different structure of the text.
* These elements specify how the web browser should display the web page.
* HTML elements are shown with labels called `tags`.
* HTML tags allow the text to be separated into headings, paragraphs, tables, figures, web links, etc. and for the browser to perceive this separation.
* Web pages do not display HTML tags on their pages, but they use them to create the page.

## Page Structure of HTML

Each HTML code consists of a heading defined by the <span class='tag'> &lt;head&gt; </span>  tag and a body defined by the <span class='tag'> &lt;body&gt; </span> tag.

The <span class='tag'> &lt;head&gt; </span> tag contains header information about the HTML being created. Header information refers to information such as heading, character set, etc.

The <span class='tag'> &lt;body&gt; </span> tag is the main text section containing other tags. This section includes section headings, lists, tables, images, website links, etc.

A comment is given between <span class='tag2'> &lt;!&#8208;&#8208; comment comes here &#8208;&#8208;&gt; </span>.
